samples.nl_statement: “The drone controller must always prevent collisions”
“The navigation module must ensure every deviation is eventually corrected”
“The safety monitor must guarantee that no unsafe state is ever reached”
“The autopilot must ensure the aircraft eventually stabilizes after turbulence”
“The cooling system must maintain temperature within limits at all times”
“The robot arm controller must ensure that overload triggers an emergency stop”
“The braking system must keep vehicle speed safe continually”
“The hazard detector must ensure that if smoke appears, an alarm is triggered”
“The stabilizer unit must maintain balance under all conditions”
“The power controller must eventually restore power after a temporary outage”
“All replicas must maintain consistency across operations”
“The leader node must ensure every request eventually receives consensus”
“The cluster managers must ensure load is balanced eventually when overloaded”
“The scheduler must guarantee that queued tasks eventually execute”
“The orchestrator must ensure all services eventually become reachable after deployment”
“The distributed monitor must always detect node failures”
“The consensus group must ensure no conflicting decisions occur”
“The membership service must eventually update the cluster view after joins/leaves”
“The replication controller must ensure updates eventually propagate to all nodes”
“The checkpoint service must always maintain a valid recovery point”
“X will eventually force B to happen.”
“X will ensure that C never becomes true.”
“X will ensure that once A becomes true, it stays true forever.”
“X will ensure that B is always true.”
“X will ensure that B will eventually become false and stay false forever.”
“X will ensure that once becomes false it stays false forever.”
“X will ensure that once D becomes false, it will eventually become true again.”
“X will ensure that C will always eventually stop being true.”
“X will ensure that B will eventually become true and stay true forever.”
“X will ensure that A and C are never true at the same time.”
“X will ensure that whenever D becomes true, B will eventually become true after it.”
“X will ensure that A happens at least once, but B never happens.”
“X will ensure that A will remain false until D becomes true.”
“X will ensure that eventually both C and D are true at the same time.”
“X will ensure that both C and D are never true at the same time.”
“X will ensure that if A is ever true, then B will eventually become.”
“X will ensure that neither A nor C ever becomes true.”
“X will ensure that eventually A or B becomes permanently true.”
“X will ensure that B eventually becomes true and remains true until C becomes false.”
“X will ensure that once C becomes true, D will eventually become false, and after that D will stay false forever.”
A user must not access a resource until authentication succeeds.
A process must not modify a file after the file has been locked.
A module must not update its configuration while it is in a failed state.
A session must not perform any action until the user identity is verified.
A user must not change permissions after the request has been revoked.
A resource must not be deleted while it is being accessed by another process.
A process must not write to a log file unless write access is granted.
A user must not view confidential data without an active authorization token.
A worker process must not start a new task while it is still handling a previous task.
A controller must not assign a resource until the resource is marked available.
A service must not trigger an update after the update window has expired.
A file must not be opened for editing unless its checksum has been validated.
A module must not transition to “active” unless initialization has completed successfully.
A user must not upload data while the system is in maintenance mode.
A background job must not run unless the scheduler signals readiness.
A request must not proceed if its integrity check fails.
A process must not execute privileged operations unless elevated rights are granted.
A session must not update user preferences before configuration data is loaded.
A resource must not enter the “deleted” state unless all dependencies are released.
A node must not send messages after it has been deactivated.
A worker must not retry an operation until the cooldown period has expired.
A module must not log events unless the logging service is available.
A transaction must not commit while any validation rule remains unsatisfied.
A user must not download files unless their access level matches the file’s classification.
A process must not interact with a queue until the queue is initialized.
A service must not accept new requests while it is shutting down.
A user must not reset their password unless identity verification succeeds.
A component must not read configuration files before initialization completes.
A process must not access shared memory unless it holds the required lock.
A transaction must not roll back after results have been committed.
A device must not send telemetry data unless connectivity is established.
A server must not accept connections when firewall rules are invalid.
A user must not change account settings without an active session.
A job must not start until all prerequisite jobs have completed.
A record must not be updated after it has been archived.
A task must not proceed while its parent task is in an error state.
A container must not launch unless the required environment variables are provided.
A user must not delete audit logs under any condition.
A process must not enter the running state unless resources are allocated.
A client must not send data before the handshake is acknowledged.
A file must not be overwritten unless write permission is explicitly granted.
A node must not participate in coordination until it has synchronized its clock.
A computation must not continue if the safety condition becomes false.
A worker must not access restricted data unless the policy rule is satisfied.
A runtime must not load plugins after the secure mode is activated.
A database must not replicate changes unless replication is enabled.
A pipeline must not advance stages while a blocking condition is active.
A message must not be delivered unless the receiver is registered.
A system must not grant access when authentication has failed.
